channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-4024] An Error/RuntimeException during transform causes an inflight exchange
item.description:
Due to a module wiring error in EAP we could not init JasyptPropertiesParser (i.e. missing wire to javax.api)

The test did not fail, instead it hang in camelctx.stop()

16:04:46,087 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultCamelContext] (pool-1-thread-1) Route: route1 started and consuming from: Endpoint[direct://start]
 
16:04:46,087 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultCamelContext] (pool-1-thread-1) Total 1 routes, of which 1 is started.
 
16:04:46,088 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultCamelContext] (pool-1-thread-1) Apache Camel 2.15.1.redhat-621037 (CamelContext: camel-1) started in 0.480 seconds
 
16:05:07,524 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultCamelContext] (pool-1-thread-1) Apache Camel 2.15.1.redhat-621037 (CamelContext: camel-1) is shutting down
 
16:05:29,899 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultShutdownStrategy] (pool-1-thread-1) Starting to graceful shutdown 1 routes (timeout 300 seconds)
 
16:05:36,559 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultShutdownStrategy] (Camel (camel-1) thread #0 - ShutdownTask) Waiting as there are still 1 inflight and pending exchanges to complete, timeout in 300 seconds.
 
16:05:37,564 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultShutdownStrategy] (Camel (camel-1) thread #0 - ShutdownTask) Waiting as there are still 1 inflight and pending exchanges to complete, timeout in 299 seconds.
 
16:05:38,568 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultShutdownStrategy] (Camel (camel-1) thread #0 - ShutdownTask) Waiting as there are still 1 inflight and pending exchanges to complete, timeout in 298 seconds.
 
16:05:39,572 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultShutdownStrategy] (Camel (camel-1) thread #0 - ShutdownTask) Waiting as there are still 1 inflight and pending exchanges to complete, timeout in 297 seconds.
 
16:05:40,576 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultShutdownStrategy] (Camel (camel-1) thread #0 - ShutdownTask) Waiting as there are still 1 inflight and pending exchanges to complete, timeout in 296 seconds.
 
16:05:41,582 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultShutdownStrategy] (Camel (camel-1) thread #0 - ShutdownTask) Waiting as there are still 1 inflight and pending exchanges to complete, timeout in 295 seconds.
 
16:05:42,587 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultShutdownStrategy] (Camel (camel-1) thread #0 - ShutdownTask) Waiting as there are still 1 inflight and pending exchanges to complete, timeout in 294 seconds.
 
16:05:43,588 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultShutdownStrategy] (Camel (camel-1) thread #0 - ShutdownTask) Waiting as there are still 1 inflight and pending exchanges to complete, timeout in 293 seconds.

This could potentially shadow many classloading issues, which are then extremely difficult to track down.

You can reproduce this by removing the javax.api dependendency in this module definition

    <module name="org.jasypt">
 
        <include artifact="org.jasypt:jasypt" />
 
        <dependencies>
 
            <module name="javax.api"/>
 
        </dependencies>
 
    </module>

and then run 

mvn clean install -Dts.basic
item.summary: An Error/RuntimeException during transform causes an inflight exchange

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Ah what kind of exception is that, is it a java.lang.Error or something then it may escape a try .. catch block etc.

It must be java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError as there is no class with that other name. And yeah its a java.lang.Error (not java.lang.Exception) and therefore likely somewhere in some code it escapes a try .. catch. The catch should be catch(Throwable) to catch them all.

That issue can be in wildfly-camel or camel or some camel component.

But as the linkage error is fatal it would not matter if the catch is fixed somewhere. You have a classloading problem.

The classloading problem is fixed. This issue is about a swallowed Error in the code that processes camelctx.stop(). The Error is associated with the Exchange.

My code is 

camelctx.start();
 
try {
 
    ProducerTemplate producer = camelctx.createProducerTemplate();
 
    String result = producer.requestBody("direct:start", "John", String.class);
 
    Assert.assertEquals("Hi John the decrypted password is: tiger", result.trim());
 
} finally {
 
    camelctx.stop();
 
}

without the stop() in finally, I see

Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/crypto/spec/PBEKeySpec
 
	at org.jasypt.encryption.pbe.StandardPBEStringEncryptor.<init>(StandardPBEStringEncryptor.java:212)
 
	at org.apache.camel.component.jasypt.JasyptPropertiesParser.initEncryptor(JasyptPropertiesParser.java:70)
 
	at org.apache.camel.component.jasypt.JasyptPropertiesParser.parseProperty(JasyptPropertiesParser.java:56)
 
	at org.apache.camel.component.properties.DefaultPropertiesParser$ParsingContext.doGetPropertyValue(DefaultPropertiesParser.java:306)
 
	at org.apache.camel.component.properties.DefaultPropertiesParser$ParsingContext.getPropertyValue(DefaultPropertiesParser.java:246)
 
	at org.apache.camel.component.properties.DefaultPropertiesParser$ParsingContext.readProperty(DefaultPropertiesParser.java:154)
 
	at org.apache.camel.component.properties.DefaultPropertiesParser$ParsingContext.doParse(DefaultPropertiesParser.java:113)
 
	at org.apache.camel.component.properties.DefaultPropertiesParser$ParsingContext.parse(DefaultPropertiesParser.java:97)
 
	at org.apache.camel.component.properties.DefaultPropertiesParser.parseUri(DefaultPropertiesParser.java:62)
 
	at org.apache.camel.component.properties.PropertiesComponent.parseUri(PropertiesComponent.java:178)
 
	at org.apache.camel.component.properties.PropertiesComponent.parseUri(PropertiesComponent.java:129)
 
	at org.apache.camel.builder.ExpressionBuilder$80.evaluate(ExpressionBuilder.java:1840)
 
	at org.apache.camel.support.ExpressionAdapter.evaluate(ExpressionAdapter.java:36)
 
	at org.apache.camel.builder.ExpressionBuilder$61.evaluate(ExpressionBuilder.java:1460)
 
	at org.apache.camel.support.ExpressionAdapter.evaluate(ExpressionAdapter.java:36)
 
	at org.apache.camel.builder.SimpleBuilder.evaluate(SimpleBuilder.java:83)
 
	at org.apache.camel.processor.TransformProcessor.process(TransformProcessor.java:50)
 
	at org.apache.camel.management.InstrumentationProcessor.process(InstrumentationProcessor.java:77)
 
	at org.apache.camel.processor.RedeliveryErrorHandler.process(RedeliveryErrorHandler.java:448)
 
	at org.apache.camel.processor.CamelInternalProcessor.process(CamelInternalProcessor.java:191)
 
	at org.apache.camel.processor.CamelInternalProcessor.process(CamelInternalProcessor.java:191)
 
	at org.apache.camel.component.direct.DirectProducer.process(DirectProducer.java:51)
 
	at org.apache.camel.processor.CamelInternalProcessor.process(CamelInternalProcessor.java:191)
 
	at org.apache.camel.util.AsyncProcessorHelper.process(AsyncProcessorHelper.java:109)
 
	at org.apache.camel.processor.UnitOfWorkProducer.process(UnitOfWorkProducer.java:68)
 
	at org.apache.camel.impl.ProducerCache$2.doInProducer(ProducerCache.java:375)
 
	... 151 more
 
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: javax.crypto.spec.PBEKeySpec from [Module "org.jasypt:main" from local module loader @2a70a3d8 (finder: local module finder @289d1c02 (roots: /Users/tdiesler/git/wildfly-camel/itests/standalone/basic/target/jboss-eap-6.4/modules,/Users/tdiesler/git/wildfly-camel/itests/standalone/basic/target/jboss-eap-6.4/modules/system/layers/fuse,/Users/tdiesler/git/wildfly-camel/itests/standalone/basic/target/jboss-eap-6.4/modules/system/layers/base))]
 
	at org.jboss.modules.ModuleClassLoader.findClass(ModuleClassLoader.java:213)
 
	at org.jboss.modules.ConcurrentClassLoader.performLoadClassUnchecked(ConcurrentClassLoader.java:459)
 
	at org.jboss.modules.ConcurrentClassLoader.performLoadClassChecked(ConcurrentClassLoader.java:408)
 
	at org.jboss.modules.ConcurrentClassLoader.performLoadClass(ConcurrentClassLoader.java:389)
 
	at org.jboss.modules.ConcurrentClassLoader.loadClass(ConcurrentClassLoader.java:134)

I tried throwing an Error on a route and did CamelContext.stop() at finally on a client, but it just succeeds and expected Error was thrown. According to the log in the description, it's just waiting for inflight exchange to be finished, but not hang.
"You can reproduce this by removing ..." see above
I mean waiting for inflight exchange on context.stop() is a valid behavior. There may be something wrong in a test case?
This behaviour does not occur when the wiring is correct and the jasypt component can be loaded (i.e. when there is no error attached to the exchange)
Is this something easy to fix for 6.2.1 or can we defer?

OK, I managed to reproduce this without WFC and arquillian. Find a testcase PropertiesComponentThrowingErrorTest.java. So the exchange is abandoned in an inflight state if the Error is thrown in PropertiesParser, while it successfully completes if the Error is thrown by Processor. Plus it didn't reproduce on camel upstream master. Claus Ibsen, do you know which changeset fixed this behavior?
Verified CAMEL-8871 fix solves the inappropriate inflight exchange.
This issue still shows on branch https://github.com/jboss-fuse/wildfly-camel/tree/2.3-redhat and therefore on fuse-eap.

In that case you would want to state here what camel-2.15.0.redhat-6.2.??? version will/does contain the fix and assign this issue to Jon. He can then resolve the issue or assign back to me when that version has made it (through perfectus magic) into fuse-eap.
Jonathan Anstey Is WFC now picking up latest camel build?

Yeah, WFC is using latest Camel build. See https://github.com/jboss-fuse/wildfly-camel/blob/2.3-redhat/pom.xml#L49-Lundefined

This is updated every time perfectus runs.
Should be ok then. marking as resolved.
